value.0:
"Do you hear that Cainite...? 
The howls of the Beast are quite clear... 

The Beast is no fabrication. It beckons at every corner -- indiscriminating as it lies in wait for the perfect chance to claw through that thin veil you call your sanity. Do not let it overtake you. For the day it triumphs over you is the day you will be undone.

Master it. Your power lies in your ability to do so."

"The path chosen to quell your beast, if any at all, is up to you. 

Many roads lay before you."

"This road is dedicated to a devotion of Set and his principles, as well as an adversity to Osiris and his. Similar to Via Peccati, kindred on this road are expected to act on their desires, working towards the advancement of their own selfishness above all else. However, unlike Via Pecatti, the followers of Via Serpentis seek to corrupt much by spreading these ideals to both kindred and mortal alike, and fighting their constant war against Osiris's repressive abuse."

"The Road of Blood, or Tariq el-Haqim, is one that is paved entirely in relentlessness. Known only to those of the Assamite clan, and any other who have been fortunate (or unfortunate) enough to come across it. Disciples of this road preach that the blood of Caine is both a dangerous and powerful gift, one that should belong only to those deserving of such power. As such, the forbidden act of diablerie is one that is condoned, as well as verily promoted, within this circle."

"Amongst the Scions, as they have come to be called, only the most elite of Cainite society gather; those daring enough to seek power in times of such volatile politics. These are the Damned that have declared it their birthright by undeath to rule these medieval nights as they bid for the throne feverishly. Such is a road of only the utmost determination, draining many Cainites of their free time and security. Indeed, anyone caring to follow such a path does so at their own discretion and knows they can trust very few Cainites, if any at all."

"To the Scions, the Beast can be both an obstacle and a tool. While it may personify the very darkness that may undo a ruler and lead to rebellion and disloyalty, it may also be the very intensity that grants a Cainite what he needs to seize power and prosper. Nevertheless, one thing is certain to the Scions. Be it a tool or burden -- it must be controlled."

"The Road of Sin knows no bounds in regards to the evils it promotes its followers to undertake. As the Sinners see it, they are eternally damned with the Cainite curse and, worse yet, are cast out by the common people as products of the Devil to be burned alive and forgotten. Far be it from them to delight in pleasures they would never have dreamed of as Kine. They see it as their obligation to satiate their unyielding desire for ecstasy and satisfaction, and would only rejoice more to destroy any who seek to stop them."

"The Sinners know and understand the Beast inside them better than any Cainite, they seek to master it with seductions, by simply feeding it and catering to its every desire. And they do this while purveying themselves with the grim amusement they so seek. Still, other Cainites look down upon the Sinners, belittling as mere slaves to the whims of the Beast. Many of these, however, do so hypocritically -- for as soon as the curtains close, they envy the Sinners for the freedom they bear."

"Much ambiguity lies in road of the Ravnos, the nature of such being colored in uncertainty. What little is understood about it, however, is that they hold belief that all things have a destiny they must accomplish. They calculate, that as such, a paradox is formed once the embrace of a Cainite takes place and, because of this, it is their sworn duty to lead others on the path to complete their own destinies or help rid the world of those who are unable to."

"The Cainite curse brings a quaint obsession with knowledge to those of this road, particularly (as most hail from clan Cappadocian) knowledge of death. The Beast within holds very little influence to these Cainite, their attention held by the countless lore that surrounds them constantly. They use the immortality granted by their unblessing to give them time unlimited, and drown themselves with the task of understanding death; hoping that in doing so, they might eventually come to fully understand themselves."

"None see the extent of the Cainite curse quite like those who live in adherence of this road, usually stemming from the Lasombra clan. They see their unlife as a curse like nothing else, preservering for the redemption they so seek. Any blatant kine sinner beheld by a follower of Via Noctis can expect to be subject to harsh punishment though on rare occassion, an embrace, with the intentions of extending the tenants of this road to the childe, may take place. Many of this road may go as far as to face Cainite tempters of man to such retribution as well."

"Predominately followed by the Tzimisce clan, the Seekers, as they are called, seek transcendence from all, believing such to be futile and unworthy of their attention. They tread this road in efforts to perfect their spirit through the power of knowledge, staying their beast with their superior willpower. For these followers of Via Mutationis, the body is but a vessel to aid in the perfection of the spirit."

"While other roads seek to seperate their nature from that of humanity, patrons of this road see no difference in spirit between them and their former selves. Their unlives are devoted to the vestige of humanity concealed by their dark souls, strengthening it ever so with compassionate actions. To them, a cold heart accompanies undeath, not a still one, and they are every bit as human as they used to be."

"To those of this path, it is the beast that activate seeks to dehumanize them. It is a paragon to everything monstrous and an obstruction to all Cainites alike. However though, they completely understand the power the beast holds over them and the urges they hold toward inhuman needs. Due to this, they constantly strive to offset these vices through diligence and repents."

"There is no single way to do this... The path chosen to quell your beast, if any at all, is up to you. 

Many roads lay before you."

"This road is dedicated to a devotion of Set and his principles, as well as an adversity to Osiris and his. Similar to Via Peccati, kindred on this road are expected to act on their desires, working towards the advancement of their own selfishness above all else. They tread this road in efforts to perfect their spirit through the power of knowledge, staying their beast with their superior willpower. For these followers of Via Mutationis, the body is but a vessel to aid in the perfection of the spirit."

"While other roads seek to seperate their nature from that of humanity, patrons of this road see no difference in spirit between them and their former selves. Their unlives are devoted to the vestige of humanity concealed by their dark souls, strengthening it ever so with compassionate actions. To them, a cold heart accompanies undeath, not a still one, and they are every bit as human as they used to be."

"To those of this path, it is the beast that activate seeks to dehumanize them. It is a paragon to everything monstrous and an obstruction to all Cainites alike. However though, they completely understand the power the beast holds over them and the urges they hold toward inhuman needs. Due to this, they constantly strive to offset these vices through diligence and repents."

"Followers of this heavenly road believe there lies redemption for the Damned and actively seek to achieve it. For them, their entire lives (and unlives) has been a test from God in hopes that their faith would not be tarnished, but elevate to all new heights. They believe that they are a part of His almighty plan for the universe, daring not to defy such law. Because of this, they can often be seen regarding themselves as chosen, not cursed."

"For these Faithful Cainites, they accredit the voice of the Beast to Satan, tempter of the devout, and ignore its attempts at corruption. They despise evil and its servants, scorning all those that seek to embrace it. Indeed, many of these religious Cainites consider themselves God's avengers, chosen by Him to prove themselves by vanquishing the darkness where it stands to pollute."

"Those who learn to embrace the Beast walk this road, relying on their Feral nature to thrive in all aspects of life. They are predators in every sense of the word, holding their instincts above all else and doing what they must to survive. Those of this road do not kill for thrills but because they must, because it is necessary. They coexist with the beast within them by answering its calls of hunger, removing any reason it has to engulf them."

"For the followers of Via Bestiae, life is what it is -now-; the past is gone, the future has yet to come. They do only what they require to satisfy their needs. Civilization has no place for them and they'd prefer nothing else. The only laws awknowledged by them are those of the wild. For them, the strong survive while the weak perish, and mercy for those who seek to threaten them, is for the weak."

Via Serpentis [The Road of the Serpent]

Via Bestiae [The Road of the Beast]
